message: Substance abuse disorders and mental health challenges impact lawyers from various backgrounds and demographics. Attorneys need to understand the possible disciplinary implications for a lawyer’s conduct while impaired. Attorneys should also be able to recognize the signs of impairment in lawyers, as well as know where to go for recovery resources and assistance. Ready to learn?
You are invited to join seasoned attorneys Laurie J. Besden and Tracy Kepler on Monday, December 11 at 2:00 p.m. ET/11:00 a.m. PT for Attorney Licensure and the Impaired Professional.
message3: *Please note: This presentation is accredited for one hour of Competence Issues MCLE credit in California and one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health Credits in North Carolina and South Carolina (all levels). It has been approved for Minimum Continuing Legal Education credit by the State Bar of Texas Committee on MCLE in the amount of one credit hour, of which one hour will apply to legal ethics credit.
If you want to earn CLE credit for your attendance at this webinar, you will need to upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to take advantage of this exclusive benefit.

message: Thank you for joining us for our recent Justia Webinars presentation, Attorney Licensure and the Impaired Professional. We love connecting our members with new learning opportunities and hope you found the webinar both engaging and informative.
As we continue to plan future Justia Webinars for Justia Connect members, we want to hear from you! If you have not already done so, please share your feedback about your recent webinar experience.
